reviewText: The second season wraps up a lot of questions, and explores some interesting story lines, no spoilers here. The writers strike may have been a cause for this series to be cancelled, and this 2nd season is fairly bare bones. I am hearing impaired, and very disappointed it was released without any subtitles, as found on Season 1. It is NOT just for deaf people, and we SHOULD be considered. It is a very minor thing to add a small text track to a disc, and I feel like they JUST DON"T CARE when it is left off. It is also very valuable to those who speak English as a 2nd language, and also helps if you just can't catch all of the fast paced dialogue. I wish everyone who CARES about this issue would say so in reviews, and hes - write letters to production companies and get vocal about it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is the shortened season of Dirt due to the writers strike. This show is great if you are a fan of sleazy people doing evil things, blackmailing each other, double crossing each other and then putting it in a magazine. The first year was great, these seven episodes will give you more for you fix, but it is sad this show did not continue. it is a true guilty pleasure

reviewText: Dirt chronicles the existence of magazines and celebrities and how articles/stories come to light and what effects those articles have on paper. Throw in some really awesome characters and sex and you've got this awesome show.It only lasted on 13 episode season and one 7 episode season (cut off due to writers strike), but it was very well done. Worth buying for twice the price to view a show that should've been into season 4 or 5 by now, but was cut short due to being thrown around in slots, delayed, etc.Buy!
summary: The most undderrated show of all time finally released...
